intro: Agalinis virginica, commonly known as the Virginia spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Agalinis virginica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
